description: Provided Tier 1 and Tier 2 technical support to 50+ faculty and students by resolving hardware/software issues, troubleshooting network problems, and configuring systems
Reduced average ticket response time by 1% by efficiently managing requests in TeamDynamix
Reimaged and updated systems with essential applications to improve performance and reduce downtime
Swapped out computer hard drives and setup computer docking stations to support multiple monitor displays for faculty
Graded assignments, exams, and taught students utilizing VS Code as an IDE for an Introduction to Python course (ENGR 102), ensuring academic accuracy
Provided feedback and assistance to students regarding Python and programming styles taught, that improved their understanding and helped them succeed in the course
Collaborated with a development team to create a fullstack application using Typescript, Drizzle, Tailwind CSS, Next.js, and PostgreSQL for each hackathon we host

Assisted competitors with questions and answered tickets during the event regarding our data science oriented challenges, covering topics like machine learning, web scraping, prompt engineering, and python libraries
Ensured the event went smoothly for participants by following the planned schedule accordingly
Provided excellent service to around 100 individuals by maintaining knowledge about attraction locations, asking questions and keeping casual conversations to help them feel welcomed and engaged

projects.description: An education website for students to learn STEM topics utilizing OpenAI as a personal tutor, practice materials, and graphical content. I worked on creating the backend architecture for the application using Prisma and connecting our SQL databases to Vercel.
A website that shows off my experiences! I will be constantly updating and remaking this, essentially showing my progression learning HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for frontend development
